docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Math is a library written in pure PHP that provides a set of classes to manipulate different formula file formats, i.e. MathML and Office MathML (OOML).

Math is an open source project licensed under the terms of MIT. Math is aimed to be a high quality software product by incorporating continuous integration and unit testing. You can learn more about Math by reading this Developers'Documentation and the API Documentation

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Insert elements:

    • Basic :

      • Identifier : a
      • Operator : +
      • Numeric : 2

    • Simple :

      • Fraction : a3
      • Superscript : a3

    • Architectural :

      • Row
      • Semantics

docs.title: Readers
docs.text: Features MathML Office MathML Basic Identifier Operator Numeric Simple Fraction Superscript Architectural Row Semantics

docs.title: Writers
docs.text: Features MathML Office MathML Basic Identifier Operator Numeric Simple Fraction Superscript Architectural Row Semantics

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
We welcome everyone to contribute to Math. Below are some of the things that you can do to contribute:

  • Fork us and request a pull to the master branch
  • Submit bug reports or feature requests to GitHub
  • Follow @PHPOffice on Twitter

docs.title: MathML
docs.text: • MDN Web Docs

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Mandatory:

  • PHP 7.1+
  • PHP DOM extension
  • PHP XML Parser extension
  • PHP XMLWriter extension

docs.title: Using Composer
docs.text:
To install via Composer, add the following lines to your composer.json:

{
"require": {
"phpoffice/math": "dev-master"
}
}

docs.title: MathML
docs.text:
The name of the reader is MathML.

<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Reader\MathML;

$reader = new MathML();
$math = $reader->read(
   '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <!DOCTYPE math PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD MathML 2.0//EN" "http://www.w3.org/Math/DTD/mathml2/mathml2.dtd">
    <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML">
        <mi> a </mi>
    </math>'
);

docs.title: OfficeMathML
docs.text:
The name of the reader is OfficeMathML.

<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Reader\OfficeMathML;

$reader = new OfficeMathML();
$math = $reader->read(
   '<m:oMathPara xmlns:m="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/officeDocument/2006/math">
      <m:oMath>
        <m:f>
          <m:num><m:r><m:t>π</m:t></m:r></m:num>
          <m:den><m:r><m:t>2</m:t></m:r></m:den>
        </m:f>
      </m:oMath>
    </m:oMathPara>'
);

docs.title: read
docs.text:
The method has one parameter :

  • string $content

The method returns a PhpOffice\Math\Math object.

docs.title: MathML
docs.text:
The name of the writer is MathML.

<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Element;
use PhpOffice\Math\Math;
use PhpOffice\Math\Writer\MathML;

$math = new Math();
$math->add(new Element\Operator('+'));

$writer = new MathML();
$output = $writer->write($math);

docs.title: OfficeMathML
docs.text:
The name of the writer is OfficeMathML.

<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Element;
use PhpOffice\Math\Math;
use PhpOffice\Math\Writer\OfficeMathML;

$math = new Math();
$math->add(new Element\Operator('+'));

$writer = new OfficeMathML();
$output = $writer->write($math);

docs.title: writer
docs.text:
The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Math $math

The method returns a string.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: To create a fraction, use the PhpOffice\Math\Element\Fraction class.

docs.title: getDenominator
docs.text: The method has no parameter.

docs.title: getNumerator
docs.text: The method has no parameter.

docs.title: setDenominator
docs.text:
The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: setNumerator
docs.text:
The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: Math
docs.text: a 3

docs.title: XML
docs.text:
<math display="block">
<mfrac>
<mi>a</mi>
<mn>3</mn>
</mfrac>
</math>

docs.title: PHP
docs.text:
<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Element;
use PhpOffice\Math\Math;

$math = new Math();

$fraction = new Element\Fraction();
$fraction->setDenominator(new Element\Identifier('a'));
$fraction->setNumerator(new Element\Numeric(3));

$math->add($fraction);

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: To create a row, use the PhpOffice\Math\Element\Row class.

docs.title: add
docs.text:
The method add an element to the row. The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: getElements
docs.text: The method return all elements of the row.

docs.title: remove
docs.text:
The method remove an element to the row. The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: XML
docs.text:
<math display="block">
<mrow>
<mn>1</mn>
<mo>+</mo>
<mi>K</mi>
</mrow>
</math>

docs.title: PHP
docs.text:
<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Element;
use PhpOffice\Math\Math;

$math = new Math();

$row = new Element\Row();
$row->add(new Element\Numeric(1));
$row->add(new Element\Operator('+'));
$row->add(new Element\Identifier('K'));

$math->add($row);

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: To create a semantics, use the PhpOffice\Math\Element\Semantics class.

docs.title: add
docs.text:
The method add an element to the semantics element. The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: addAnnotation
docs.text:
The method add an annotation to the semantics element. The method has two parameters :

  • string $encoding
  • string $annotation

docs.title: getAnnotation
docs.text:
The method return an annotation based on its encoding. The method has one parameter :

  • string $encoding

docs.title: getAnnotations
docs.text: The method return alls annotation of the semantics element. The method has no parameter.

docs.title: getElements
docs.text: The method return all elements of the semantics element.

docs.title: remove
docs.text:
The method remove an element to the semantics element. The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: Math
docs.text: y  y

docs.title: XML
docs.text:
<math display="block">
<semantics>
<mi>y</mi>

<annotation encoding="application/x-tex"> y </annotation>
</semantics>
</math>

docs.title: PHP
docs.text:
<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Element;
use PhpOffice\Math\Math;

$math = new Math();

$semantics = new Element\Semantics();
$semantics->add(new Element\Identifier('y'));
$semantics->addAnnotation('application/x-tex', ' y ');

$math->add($semantics);

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: To attach a superscript to an expression, use the PhpOffice\Math\Element\Superscript class.

docs.title: getBase
docs.text: The method has no parameter.

docs.title: getSuperscript
docs.text: The method has no parameter.

docs.title: setBase

The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: setSuperscript
docs.text:
The method has one parameter :

  • PhpOffice\Math\Element\AbstractElement $element

docs.title: Math
docs.text: X 2

docs.title: XML
docs.text:
<math display="block">
<msup>
<mi>X</mi>
<mn>2</mn>
</msup>
</math>

docs.title: PHP
docs.text:
<?php

use PhpOffice\Math\Element;
use PhpOffice\Math\Math;

$math = new Math();

$superscript = new Element\Superscript();
$superscript->setBase(new Element\Identifier('X'));
$superscript->setSuperscript(new Element\Numeric(2));

$math->add($superscript);
